heating_text: I have a newborn baby so the hearing is on nearly all day.
It’s on low and I boost it when needed also on a timer in the morning
Permanent 20 degrees controlled by heating control device
Set timers for night and early morning
Temperature 20-21 degrees
Gas 20 degrees

30 degrees for an hour at a time as the kids get cold. 30 degrees in the morning at 6.30am for an hour and then on again just before school to heat up the house for the kids arrival at 3.15pm for an hour, then finally 30 degrees for an hour before bedtime at 6.30pm.
Leave heating at reasonable temperature
Heating is usually on most of the time as I have a reduced immune system due to medication for Crohn's disease
Heating is on a timer: 2 hours in the morning and 2 hours in the evening. The hearing will turn off within these 2 hour windows if it reaches over 20C. I leave it on when I'm out (as I have pets)
information_text2: I chanced upon information about heat networks when reviewing some research on clean domestic heating options at my job

heating_text: in winter I have the heating on all the time because I have small children at home, the temperature is 22 degrees Celsius
Set the timer to heated in sets time
Heating is set at 20 degrees C for short periods of time during the day, which are set on a timer
High temperature for short spells
Timer setting
Gas
Its manually turned on but has a 2 hours timer. The maximum heat is 23°c.
Lukewarm
The heating is set at 20 degrees centigrade all day when we are in town. It is kept at 9 degrees centigrade when we are out of town, which is several times a year.
heating_text_2: I use small ceramic room heaters in the conservatory and my study, when needed. This is usually about one hour every day.

heating_text: Turn on when it gets too cold (Short Spells)
Heating is on throughout the day on a moderate temperature. Switched off after 6 in the evening as we have an electric throw blanket
Turn it on high when it's cold. Also only have heating on at all if I can afford to put it on.
I turn on high for a short spell. Sometimes leave it on 12 when I go out. I do not use timer.
Heat to 18 degrees C on a timer 1 hour at 5am and 2 hours 7-9pm
leave heating on low
Gas central heating. It is on a timer to give heat in the morning and evening. Set to 19 degrees, but we turn it up when necessary.
Gas,electricity all off at night daily temperature 23 degrees heating left on if we go out. Use manual setting
